availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Kidd (Hart County, Kentucky, farmhand and pvt 26th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Kidd and Mary Kidd. Resident of Hart County in 1850. Farmhand and student in Hart County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from September 26, 1862, to June 30, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 242A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Horse Cave, District 1, p. 724.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0379.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #346094, Certificate #566542.
Find A Grave, "William D. Kidd (1842-1918)," Memorial #51940154, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51940154 (accessed December 8, 2020).
